author: FatalBulletHit
body:
## Steps to reproduce
Run the following with the latest preview version ([`7.1.0-rc.2`](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/tag/v7.1.0-rc.2)) or the latest release version ([`7.1.0`](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/tag/v7.1.0)) of PowerShell 7:
```powershell
(Get-ChildItem $PSHOME -File).Count
(Get-ChildItem $PSHOME -File | ForEach-Object { Get-Content $_.FullName -Tail 1 }).Count
```

## Expected behavior
Output
```none
449
449
```
Works as intended in the previous release version ([`7.0.3`](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/tag/v7.0.3)).

## Actual behavior
Output
```none
449
26
```

## Environment data

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.0-rc.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.0-rc.2
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19041
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Please create more simple repro steps with one file.

comments.author: FatalBulletHit
comments.body:
Made it even simpler I guess and if you need a reference file, just use the `Accessibility.dll` from the PowerShell 7 installation directory or download it: [`Accessibility.dll.txt`](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/files/5524668/Accessibility.dll.txt)

I'm fairly sure the issue has something to do with special characters, shouldn't be down to my system either as I was able to reproduce it in a VM.
